Henry Louis "Lou" or "Buster" Gehrig was an American baseball first baseman 
who played 17 seasons in Major League Baseball (MLB) for the New York 
Yankees, from 1923 through 1939. Gehrig was renowned for his prowess as a 
hitter and for his durability, a trait that earned him his nickname "The Iron Horse".
